tool.name: muse call
tool.description: First step of somatic point mutation caller for tumor-normal paired samples in next-generation sequencing data.
tool.command: ##creation of the bam indexes and execution of the MuSE call command with all the advanced options samtools index $input2 && samtools index $input3 && MuSE call -O variant_call -f $input1 $input2 $input3 #if $region -r $region #end if #if $positions -l $positions #end if

param.name: positions
param.label: list of regions
param.help: file txt or BED (chr:pos-pos or BED),with one region per line

tool.help:
**MuSE call**, takes as input the indexed reference genome FASTA file and the BAM file from normal and tumoral sample. The BAM files require aligning all the sequence reads against the reference genome using the Burrows-Wheeler alignment tool (BWA), with either the backtrack or the maximal exact matches (MEM) algorithm. In addition, the BAM files need to be processed by following the Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) Best Practices that include: Marking duplicates,realigning the paired tumor-normal BAMs jointly recalibrating base quality scores. More information at MuSE: http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/MuSE
Galaxy wrapper for MuSE call implements all options available through the command line. Supported options are described below.
Usage: MuSE call [options] tumor.bam matched_normal.bam Options: -f FILE faidx indexed reference sequence file -r STR single region (chr:pos-pos) where somatic mutations are called -l FILE list of regions (chr:pos-pos or BED), one region per line -O STR output file name (suffix '.MuSE.txt' is automatically added)
